chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Greco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Greco

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of letter from DA to victim advising of disposition of case.

Defendant Michael A Greco in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State files an amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon plea to charge in amended information, the State recommends a fine and CFTS.
P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. $100 + cc, RCJ=CFTS.  PP $50/mo to begin 8/7 with a 7 day grace period. FTP - 3 mos RCJ
Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness. VI- K.B.   No amount given - victim information only.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim KB (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael A Greco in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Defendant Michael A Greco in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond modification. State does not object. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond is modified to a $1000.00 signature bond. Same conditions apply.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim KB (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael A Greco in court with attorney Sean Brown.  Defendant Michael A Greco in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
